ygData.subject: First species suddenly die in rtNEAT C++

Subject: First species suddenly die in rtNEAT C++
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=283334584; y=QtaQngH6G_eHhGOYGB4BtYICTzdVU6Xkp6MxGkC31IZxa-8acs_NzPLN8Q

Hello there. 

I am using a modified version of the rtNEAT code release, to=
 evolve 
roving eyes that identify grayscale images. It is very similar to =
the 
active vision system in ANJI. I use only the basic generational NEAT 
=
methods there, no matter that there is realtime code. I expanded the 
packa=
ge with CTRNN neurons support and nice visualisation of NNs for 
Windows. 
=

I set up the compatibility theshold to be high enough, so that in the 
fir=
st 2-3 generations there will be only one species. But when some 
mutations=
 occur and 1-2 new species appear, the first species die and 
the whole pop=
ulation is replaced by the new ones. 

I think this is wrong. After some in=
vestigation, I found that in the 
NEAT::Population::epoch(int gen) method, =
there is code that checks 
for coevolution stagnation. Something happens an=
d the first species 
get marked as oblitarate. 

---- CODE ----

//Flag the=
 lowest performing species over age 20 every 30 generations 
//NOTE: THIS I=
S FOR COMPETITIVE COEVOLUTION STAGNATION DETECTION

	curspecies=3Dsorted_sp=
ecies.end();
	curspecies--;
	while((curspecies!=3Dsorted_species.begin())&&=

		((*curspecies)->age<20))
		--curspecies;
	if ((generation%30)=3D=3D0)
		=
(*curspecies)->obliterate=3Dtrue;

---- CODE END ----


When I commented th=
is out, the problem was fixed. My system still 
performs below expectations=
, but this is something I should tell you.

Peter
